intro: Chlamydia tenacissima, commonly known as the common tansy, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and small yellow flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in meadows and woodland areas. Chlamydia tenacissima is known for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional herbal remedies.
